1.title: Animal Farm
1.author: George Orwell
1.overview: beast fable in the form of a political satire.

2.title: The Republic
2.author: Plato
2.overview: Socratic dialogue concerning justice, order, a just city and a just man.

3.title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
3.author: Ken Kesey
3.overview: Set in an Oregon psychiatric hospital, the narrative serves as a study of institutional processes and the human mind, including a critique of psychiatry and a tribute to individualistic principles

4.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
4.author: Harper Lee
4.overview: The story of racial injustice and the loss of innocence in the American South.

5.title: The Great Gatsby
5.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
5.overview: A story of the American Dream and the Roaring Twenties.

6.title: Becoming
6.author: Michelle Obama
6.overview: The memoir of the former First Lady of the United States.

7.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
7.author: Delia Owens
7.overview: A mystery and coming-of-age novel set in the marshes of North Carolina.

8.title: The Catcher in the Rye
8.author: J.D. Salinger
8.overview: A novel about a teenager's experiences in New York City.

9.title: The Alchemist
9.author: Paulo Coelho
9.overview: A philosophical novel that follows a young shepherd's journey.

10.title: A Game of Thrones
10.author: George R.R. Martin
10.overview: The first book in the 'A Song of Ice and Fire' series.

11.title: The Hobbit
11.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
11.overview: The classic fantasy novel about Bilbo Baggins' adventures.

12.title: Fahrenheit 451
12.author: Ray Bradbury
12.overview: A dystopian novel set in a future where books are banned.
